RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 84. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COREY AND QUINN broke in at the start brushing SPUN SPECIAL, vied briefly with a pair before chasing three then two wide advancing on the leader to take command just inside the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive and held sway to the finish kept to task. LA GIRVINA broke out at the start and was bumped by SPUN SPECIAL conceding three lengths to the front, chased along the inside until tipped two then three wide to the three-eighths, tipped four wide placed to coaxing near the quarter pole, swung six wide into upper stretch, ran on to chase the winner home clear of the rest and along second best. VIVID DREAMS broke out at the start under coaxing, chased five wide early on before tucking three to four wide nearing the half mile pole, went to the two path through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, offered up a bid a furlong out, then weakened in the late stages. TAKE TIME TO DREAM broke out at the start under coaxing, chased six paths off the inside down the backstretch and then four wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung six to seven wide into upper stretch, made no late headway. CRUSHED ICE struck the off side stall at the start, ranged up to vie briefly with a pair before chasing four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide for home and tired. SPUN SPECIAL broke in at the start under hustling and bumped LA GIRVINA, vied briefly with a pair to the outside before emerging with sole command at the nine-sixteenths, tucked inside through the turn coming under pressure midway, yielded the front inside the five-sixteenths and took the inside route into upper stretch, then tired in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: La Girvina
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out, bumped st, chased ins, tip 2-3w turn, 6w uppr, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Spun Special
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump foe st, vied briefly, in hand 2p, ins turn, ins 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Corey and Quinn
ENTRY.OWNER: LaPenta Robert V Madaket Stables LLC and ERJ Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, vied briefly, chased 3-2w, up 5/16, 2w 1/4p, edged clr

ENTRY.NAME: Crushed Ice
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate st, vied briefly, 4-5w early, 3w turn, 5w uppr, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Vivid Dreams
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, 5w early, to 3p 1/2, 2p turn, 4w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Take Time to Dream
ENTRY.OWNER: MeB Racing Stables LLC Falcone Jr Robert N and League of Their Own Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, 6w backstretch, 4w turn, 6-7w upper, no late headway

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 32000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR THREE YEAR OLD FILLIES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $14,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: T MAX went four wide early on the first turn, dropped to the two path later on that bend then moved clear, showed the way with a clear advantage, controlled the action while inside on the far turn, spun off the rail while shaken up some into upper stretch and drew off under strong urging while drifting out in the drive. LUNA LOCA went three wide on the first turn, was taken up when the winner crossed in front late on that bend, settled just off the pace, chased inside on the final turn, was driven three wide into the stretch and earned the place while no match for the winner. ACCEL ROSE hit the outside of the gate at the start, traveled around the first turn in the two path, was urged along on the backstretch, went three to four wide on the far turn, drifted out in the stretch and was along for the show. SIMPLE SUGAR was caught five wide on the first turn, raced up close on the outside, was urged along late on the backstretch, chased in the three path on the far turn, spun four wide into the stretch, dropped back while remaining on her inside lead in the drive and came up empty. SWEET AS SUGAR was last to commence, raced in the three path on the first turn, settled near the back, moved from the two path to the four path under urging on the far turn, came six wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. RACING COLORS moved from the rail to the two path on the first turn, settled near the rear, moved out under a strong hand-ride near the five-eighths pole, went four then five wide on the far turn and was no factor. REDZILLA was hustled from the gate, saved ground on the first turn, was coaxed along down the backstretch, dropped back two then three wide on the far turn and retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Accel Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate,2p1st,urged,3-4w2nd,drifted out stretch,up for show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 84. Starter Allowance Purse 70000. INNER TURF (UP TO $12,180 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-w inners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WESTERN LANE traded a bump after the start with MISS SAN GABRIEL, chased just off the inside until tucked inside at the seven-sixteenths placed to light coaxing, advanced on the rail taking command taking the inside route into upper stretch, dug in under threat to the outside, dueled through to the finish in game fashion to fend off the runner up by a sliver on the wire. DUCKPHAT chased three to four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued three to four wide into upper stretch, dug in latching on the aforementioned foe a furlong out, dueled through to the finish in game fashion but was ultimately denied on the line by a nostril. POUT chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued two to three wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late stages. MISS SAN GABRIEL stumbled at the start, then traded a bump after the start with WESTERN LANE, advanced to seize command tucking to the inside midway through the opening bend, showed the way in hand along the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the far turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun along the two path at the quarter pole getting displaced and placed in tight pausing between foes before straightening away for home, then tired and was eased home through the final eighth. JUDGEMENT TIME raced along the inside and was unsettled under restraint getting steadied at the seven-eighths when MISS SAN GABRIEL took over and tucked in front and again six and a half furlongs from home into the backstretch, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, got out four wide at the three-eighths, angled back inwards and spun just off the inside into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Judgement Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: steady 7/8 & 6 1/2, chased ins, got out 4w 3/8, 2w 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Miss San Gabriel
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, bump after st, in hand ins, tight btw 1/4, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Western Lane
ENTRY.OWNER: Blue Streak Racing LLC Second Opinion Stable and Spiesman Rich
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump after st, chased 2p, to ins 7/16, up ins 1/4, dug in, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Duckphat
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-4w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 3-4w upper, dueled str, game, denied

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 84. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STUNNINGLY went to the front in the two path on the first turn, showed the way on the inside of a rival, vied in the two then three path on the far turn, was headed by the runner-up while in the four path into upper stretch, dueled inside of that foe, fought back gamely to regain the lead in the final sixteenth and prevailed under good handling. REVOLVING CREDIT was hustled from the gate, went around the first turn in the three path, prompted the pace on the outside, vied in the three then four path on the far turn, took the lead in the five path into upper stretch, dueled outside of the winner under a drive, lost the advantage in the final sixteenth and missed while clear for the place. PARIS STYLE (FR) was bumped in the hindquarters after the start, raced inside to the two path on the first turn, settled off the pace, chased in the two path on the far turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and weakened but was clear for the show. MAGICAL SONG broke out and in the back half of the field, saved ground on the first turn, settled well off the pace, was roused while inside on the far turn, turned into the stretch in the two path, moved out under a left-handed crop outside the sixteenth-pole and failed to threaten. MISS OUR HERO broke a bit slow, went three wide on the first turn, was rated just off the pace, tugged hard on the bit under tight restraint approaching the five-eighths pole, was given her cue in the three path on the far turn, chased four wide into the stretch and came up empty. RHIANNON bumped the hindquarters of a rival after the start then was taken up in tight between horses, went four wide going around the opening bend, settled on the outside, was roused while moving from three to five wide on the far turn and failed to respond. RAYYA VALENTINE was off slow then stumbled, went around both turns in the two path and was no factor. KEEP IT SEXY was hustled from the gate, went five wide on the first turn, was forwardly placed on the outside, passed the nine-sixteenths under urging, dropped back four to five wide on the final turn and retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Magical Song
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,ins1st,settld,rousd rail2nd,2p1/4,mvd out ins1/8,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Paris Style (FR)
ENTRY.OWNER: Walking L Thoroughbreds LLC and Three Chimneys Farm

ENTRY.NAME: Rhiannon
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd after brk,tkn up,4w1st,out,3-5w2nd turn,no response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 5 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 95. Allowance Purse 149500. (PURSE $115,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile and One Eighth on the Main Track). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRUPI got bumped between foes at the start, went three then two wide through the first turn, tracked just off the inside in range of the leader settled in the one and one, came under pair of right handed taps from the crop with nine-sixteenths to go, then came under urging at the half mile pole and bid latching on the leader to duel through the turn taking over narrow command just outside the quarter pole, swung three wide into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive kept to task. ROYAL SPIRIT broke out at the start bumping CRUPI in tandem with PADDINGTON, tracked the pace along the inside, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths when CRUPI advanced outside to engage the leader, angled out five wide into upper stretch, kept on under a drive to secure the place honors. PADDINGTON broke in at the start bumping CRUPI in concert with ROYAL SPIRIT, came under coaxing and established the front shortly after, showed the way in hand just off the inside until tucked along the inside into the backstretch, remained on hold through sensible splits, had the eventual winner range up outside just inside the half mile pole and was put to pressure under challenge for the front coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths and then a drive with three furlongs to go, matched strides until headed just outside the quarter pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, then gave way and was eased home through the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, tracked ins, coaxed 7/16, angled 5w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Crupi
ENTRY.OWNER: Repole Stable and St Elias Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmp btw st, tracked 2p, urged 1/2, bid, up, 3w uppr, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Paddington
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in, coaxed st, in hand ins, urged 7/16,yielded, 2w 1/4, eased

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of YOR

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 75. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DANCING MISCHIEF was hustled from the gate, moved from the rail to the two path late on the first turn, tracked the pace down the backstretch, ranged up in the three path on the far turn, was asked near the five-sixteenths then made a bid outside the quarter-pole, took the lead at the top of the stretch then kicked clear inside the three-sixteenths, drifted in some under a right-handed crop coming to the furlong marker and drew away under steady urging. KHADULLAH broke out but was away towards the front, dropped from the three path to the rail while going to the front on the first turn, showed the way with an uncontested, vied in the two path early on the far turn then dropped to the rail, was asked approaching the quarter-pole, lost the advantage at the top of the stretch, moved out behind the winner near the furlong marker and weakened but just held the place. ERIC FROM MIAMI was hustled from the gate, went four wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, was roused four wide on the far turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and just missed the place while able to get the show. SAVAGE SPIRIT was fractious in the gate, broke a bit slow while forced out, went four under urging on the first turn, settled outside under some encouragement, went four to five wide on the far turn, was driven six wide into the stretch and missed the trifecta while clear for the last spot in the superfecta. A KNIGHT'S COURAGE broke out at the start, rounded the first turn in the two path, settled in the front half of the field, traveled three wide on the far turn, was asked inside the three-eighths and came up empty. ONE WITHEVERYTHING veered out then hit the gate and was off slow, spotted the front several lengths, went four wide on the first turn, settled at the rear, went three wide on the final turn and was no factor. LOVE THAT BIRD was hustled from the start, saved ground while dropping back under vigorous urging on the first turn, continued to fall further off the pace on the backstretch, moved from the rail to the two path on the far turn and showed little. FROZEN FOUR was hustled from the start, came out to the two path on the first turn, settled well off the pace, dropped back while inside to the two path on the far turn and faltered then was eased but walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Love That Bird
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,drop back hard ridden rail1st,well back,ins-2p2nd,outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Dancing Mischief
ENTRY.OWNER: R A Hill Stable and SGV Thoroughbreds

ENTRY.NAME: A Knight's Courage
ENTRY.OWNER: Brady Horse Racing and Rusba V Stables

ENTRY.NAME: Savage Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate,off step slow,frcd out,4-5w turns,6w1/4,missed tri

ENTRY.NAME: Khadullah
ENTRY.OWNER: Rodriguez, Rudy R. and Imperio, Michael

ENTRY.NAME: One Witheverything
ENTRY.OWNER: Benoit Craig Mierzejewski Heather Filpi Michael and Tynan David
ENTRY.COMMENT: veer out,hit gate,off slw,at rear,4-3path turns,no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 7 1 3/16M Dirt CR: 107. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 156000. (PURSE $120,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $27,144 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Du e At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLUE DEVIL coaxed from the gate, raced three then two wide through the first turn before chasing three wide down the backstretch in closest aim of the leader, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths and began to advance, continued three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive outside a pair through the final furlong fighting on gamely and was just up in the shadow of the wire to score. COSTA TERRA just off the inside in pursuit from near the rear of the field, tucked inside at the nine-sixteenths, came under coaxing at the half mile pole and advanced in a prolonged drive through the turn into contention taking the inside route into upper stretch, had SPEED BIAS take the rail directly in front near the three-sixteenths and was forced to alter to the two path just inside that station, rallied between foes through the final furlong battling on gamely to the finish and just missed at the end. SPEED BIAS coaxed from the start, showed the way in hand just off the inside before tucking inside down the backstretch, tipped back to the two path through the far turn and came under challenge inside the five-sixteenths getting placed to coaxing before being set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in and tucked to the rail at the three-sixteenths forcing the aforementioned foe to tip out, clung to command from a challenging pair to the outside through the final eighth but was nailed in the last jumps by both while well clear of the rest for the show honors. RED RUN broke out at the start and was corrected, chased just off the inside getting coaxed along at the three-eighths, swung two to three wide into upper stretch and weakened. PORTOS saved ground at the tail of the field, came under coaxing half a mile from home and received two taps to the right side, angled three wide into upper stretch, passed a pair of rivals while unable to make an impact. BOURBON CALLING just off the inside through the first turn, chased four wide under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, continued four wide into upper stretch, tired. HE'S A MESS four then three wide through the first turn, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, swung four to five wide into upper stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Portos
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved grd at rear, coaxed 1/2p, angled 3w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Red Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 2p, coaxed along 3/8, 2-3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Speed Bias
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnston Keith F and Sparks William S
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand 2p, set down 2w 1/4p, to ins 3/16, nailed

ENTRY.NAME: Costa Terra
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p early, to ins 9/16, ins 1/4, alter 2p 3/16, fought btw, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Blue Devil
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 3-2w 1st trn, chased 3w, 3w uppr, dug in game, just up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Skidmore S. SARATOGA RACE 8 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 90. Stakes Purse 150000. FOR TWO YEAR OLDS. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $150 each which should accompany the nomination; $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 122 lbs. Non-winners of a race other than claiming allowed 2 lbs.; maidens allowed 4 lbs. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to t ransfer this race to the main track. Closed Saturday, August 5, 2023 with 19 Original Nominations and 2 Supplements. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on theM
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHIP CADET broke very fast and was hustled while going straight to the front, showed the way down the backstretch, vied inside on the turn, responded well when asked for his best off the rail in upper stretch, came under the crop outside the furlong marker and was fully extended to last and prevail. EL GRANDE O broke in and bumped with a foe, chased the pace on the outside, went four then five wide on the turn, was joined on the outside by ANTONIO OF VENICE near the five-sixteenths then steadied in tight between horses, came out six wide at the quarter-pole then had the rider hesitate while trying to give relief to troubled horses in behind, picked up momentum in pursuit of the winner inside the three-sixteenths, drifted in under a right-handed crop outside the sixteenth-pole then was switched to a left-handed crop and gained to the finish but missed while able to get the place. SEIZE THE GREY bumped with a rival while last to commence, was hard ridden early then paused while crowded outside the nine-sixteenths before coming back under urging, moved from the rail to the two path on the turn, steadied behind a bumping skirmish outside the quarter-pole, swerved out eight wide while altering out badly at the top of the stretch, gained outside into the final furlong, drifted in outside the sixteenth-pole and finished with good courage for the show. BILLY THE GREEK brushed the outside of the gate at the start then bumped with a foe, was urged along off the pace, went three wide on the turn, bumped with a rival while put in tight at the quarter-pole then checked very sharply while forced over heels to the six path and lacked the needed response. GO OTTO GO bumped with rivals on both sides at the start and was off near the rear, settled towards the back on the outside, tucked into the two path for the run around the turn, came out behind a wayward foe nearing the quarter-pole, bumped with BILLY THE GREEK then steadied at the top of the stretch and also lacked the needed response. ANTONIO OF VENICE was urged along on the far outside, chased five then six wide on the turn, dropped to the three path into upper stretch and tired. UNTROUBLED broke in then was sent hard, chased the pace, went two then three wide on the turn, came out a bit more into upper stretch and capitulated. SEBASTIAN RUN broke out and bumped with a foe, was urged along towards the rear, saved ground on the turn and was no factor. FIVE O' SOMEWHERE moved up to press the pace on the outside, vied in the three to four path on the turn, dropped back while drifting about near the quarter-pole and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Ship Cadet
ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp Staudacher David Haynes Kevin and Huber John

ENTRY.NAME: Five o' Somewhere
ENTRY.OWNER: Spraggins Kenneth R Palazzo Marilyn Atanacio Edna Atanacio Richard Mueda-Sadural

ENTRY.NAME: Go Otto Go
ENTRY.OWNER: Three Chimneys Farm LLC (Goncalo B Torrealba)

ENTRY.NAME: El Grande O
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in,bmpd foe,chsd out,4-5w turn,stdied ins5/16,pause6w1/4,gain

ENTRY.NAME: Antonio of Venice
ENTRY.OWNER: Imperio Michael Cotrone Robert Hibiscus Stables LLC and Rodriguez Rudy R

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of ASC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 9 6F Dirt CR: 99. Claiming Purse 80000. (UP TO $13,920 NYSBFOA) FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $40,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRISONER dueled early on down the backstretch three to four paths off the inside with HAPPY FARM to his outside, tucked to the two path into the turn shaking away to a safe lead, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in confronted by the runner up, dueled again through to the finish getting headed for the front before being bumped by that rival a sixteenth out, took back command just after the contact and held gamely to prevail at the finish. SEVEN NATION ARMY broke in at the start, chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, rallied to issue a challenge and duel through the final furlong with the aforementioned foe to his inside, came inwards taking narrow and brief command just outside the sixteenth pole, bumped with PRISONER at that station, then got headed inside that juncture, fought on but was ultimately bested at the end. THINKABOUTIT coaxed from the gate, chased five to six paths off the inside down the backstretch and then four wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, got floated out eight wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick to secure the show honors. RAM six paths off the inside early on, tucked four wide through most of the backstretch before going three wide through the turn getting placed to coaxing at the three-eighths, got floated out eight to nine wide into upper stretch and kicked on belatedly through the stretch. WENDELL FONG seven paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked briefly three wide near the half mile pole before taking to the two path into the turn, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, floated out six to seven wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild bid but was out-finished. HAPPY FARM coaxed from the gate, dueled early on four to five paths off the inside with PRISONER to his inside, tucked three wide into the turn shaken off a bit and gave chase coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four to five wide into upper stretch and weakened. CEES GET DEGREES chased six to seven paths off the inside down the backstretch and then five wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, went eight to nine wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Seven Nation Army
ENTRY.OWNER: Rodriguez Gustavo and Wojdyla Randall S
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in, chased 2p, ins turn, 3w uppr, dueled str, up 1/16, bested

ENTRY.NAME: Prisoner
ENTRY.OWNER: Baker, Charlton and Paolangeli, Francis J.
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled early 3-4w, 2p turn, 2w 1/4, duel str, headed 1/16, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, dueled early 4-5w, chased 3w turn, 4-5w uppr, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Thinkaboutit
ENTRY.OWNER: Zilla Racing Stables and Acqua Nova Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 5-6w backstretch, 4w turn, 8w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Ram
ENTRY.OWNER: Baker Christina and Mack William L

ENTRY.NAME: Wendell Fong
ENTRY.OWNER: Dark Horse Racing Stable Serio Racing Stables and Spiesman Rich
ENTRY.COMMENT: 7w early, tucked 3w 1/2p, 2p turn, floated 6-7w uppr, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 10 1M Dirt CR: 97. Allowance Purse 95000. INNER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 1 25 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CUT THE CORD went around the first turn in the two path, settled well off the pace, moved from the two path to the four path under urging on the far turn, rallied five wide into the stretch, closed strongly to get the lead inside the furlong marker then drew clear under a moderate hand-ride to prove much the best. FACTUALLY CORRECT showed speed on the inside, was eased back late on the first turn then moved out onto the backstretch, tracked the pace on the outside, took the lead in the three path with three furlongs to run, inched clear under the crop in upper stretch, led under a drive until inside the furlong marker then was overtaken while just able to hold the place. BOURBON CHASE went two to three wide on the first turn, settled at the rear, saved ground under urging on the far turn, gained while cutting the corner into the stretch, chased along the rail in the drive and just missed the place while clear for the show. ASYMMETRIC was bumped lightly at the start, went four wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, dropped in leaving the backstretch, went two to three wide early on the turn then angled five wide, dropped to the four path into the stretch, chased outside into the final furlong and weakened. LITTLE MADDY BROWN broke out then made light contact with an opponent, moved to the front while dropping from the five path to the two path on the first turn, showed the way down the backstretch, vied inside under urging on the far turn, lost the lead at the three-eighths, dropped back in upper stretch and tired. RALLY SQUIRREL rounded the first turn in the two path, settled off the pace, chased four wide on the far turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Factually Correct
ENTRY.OWNER: Cotrone Robert Imperio Michael Gurdon Andrew O Rodriguez Rudy R Gabrielle Farm M
